meanings.definition: To remove or release from a step or support.
meanings.sent1: She had to unstep from the ladder carefully.
meanings.sent2: He unstepped the ladder from the wall after painting.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to unstep from the high shelf but got stuck.
meanings.sent4: The decision to unstep from the project was difficult but necessary.
meanings.sent5: Unstepping from the ladder, she felt a sense of relief.

meanings.definition: To take a step backward or away from a position.
meanings.sent1: He decided to unstep from the argument to avoid conflict.
meanings.sent2: She unstepped from the edge of the cliff in fear.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that he would unstep from his bad jokes.
meanings.sent4: Unstepping from his responsibilities, he felt a weight lifted off his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: In the game of chess, sometimes you have to unstep to win.

meanings.definition: To stop or interrupt a process or action.
meanings.sent1: She had to unstep the machine to fix the jam.
meanings.sent2: He unstepped the conversation when it became too heated.
meanings.sent3: The teacher had to unstep the students from their chatter.
meanings.sent4: Unstepping the meeting abruptly surprised everyone.
meanings.sent5: The emergency brake was used to unstep the train in time.
